text: TITLE: Ardha Chakrasana (Half Spinal Twist)
CATEGORY: Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Balancing on one hand while extending the other to create a gentle arc with the upper torso.
BENEFITS: - Stretches the front of the body and chest - Tones the muscles in the shoulders and arms
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with wrist, arm, or shoulder injuries - Skip if balance is a challenge due to medical conditions
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners wanting to open the chest.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Badhakonasana (Butterfly Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Sitting Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - A seated posture where the soles of the feet are brought together and knees move gently.
BENEFITS: - Improves flexibility in the inner thighs and hips. - Stimulates abdominal organs to aid digestion. - Relieves fatigue from long hours of standing.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Practice gently or avoid with knee or groin injuries. - Do not force the knees to the floor.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners and those with hip stiffness.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Bhujangasana (Cobra Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Lying Pose (Stomach) – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Lying on the stomach and gently lifting the chest upward using the back muscles.
BENEFITS: - Strengthens the entire length of the spine. - Opens the chest and improves upper body flexibility. - Tones the abdominal muscles.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with a hernia or recent abdominal surgery. - Not recommended during pregnancy.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners wanting to improve posture.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Dhanurasana (Bow Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Lying Pose (Stomach) – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Lying on the stomach and reaching back to hold the ankles, forming a bow shape.
BENEFITS: - Stretches the front of the body and the throat. - Adds great flexibility to the back and strengthens legs. - Massages internal organs for better digestive health.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with high blood pressure or heart conditions. - Skip with migraines or lower back injuries.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners looking for a deep front stretch.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Garudasana (Eagle Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Wrapping the arms and legs together while balancing on one foot.
BENEFITS: - Enhances coordination and body stability - Stretches the upper back, shoulders, and outer thighs - Effective for developing deep concentration
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with neck pain or lower back issues - Not for individuals with knee injuries
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners needing coordination.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Hastapadasana (Standing Bend)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - A standing bend where the upper body folds toward the legs to make the spine more supple.
BENEFITS: - Refreshing and invigorating for the nervous system - Stretches all the muscles located along the back - Improves spinal flexibility
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with chronic back or neck injuries - Not recommended for those recovering from leg injuries
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners looking for back flexibility.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Katichakrasana (Standing Spinal Twist)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level

DESCRIPTION: - A standing posture involving a gentle rotation of the waist to stretch the hips and the entire length of the spine. BENEFITS  : - Relieves constipation and supports digestion - Strengthens the neck and shoulders - Beneficial for individuals with desk-bound jobs
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid if you have a hernia - Not for individuals with spinal conditions or heart problems - Skip if you have high blood pressure
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Office workers and beginners.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Konasana (Sideways Bending Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Konasana is a standing sideways bending yoga posture. In this pose, one arm is raised upward while the torso gently bends to the side, stretching the lateral muscles of the body.

BENEFITS: - Improves balance and body coordination - Releases tension along the sides of the body and spine - Increases flexibility of the back and hips - Supports healthy digestion - Helps reduce mild physical stiffness
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid if you have neck, hip, or spinal injuries - Not recommended for people with high blood pressure - Avoid during migraines or severe dizziness
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners and those seeking light stretching.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Marjariasana (Cat-Cow Pose)
CATEGORY: Yoga Asana – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: Moving the spine up and down while on hands and knees in a rhythmic motion.
BENEFITS: - Brings mobility and warmth to the back muscles. - Improves blood circulation throughout the spinal column. - Releases physical stress in the shoulders.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Move slowly with chronic neck or wrist pain. - Do not over-arch if the lower spine is sensitive.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners and those with stiff backs.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Paschim_Namaskarasana (Reverse Prayer Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Joining the palms together behind the back with fingertips pointing upward.
BENEFITS: - Opens the chest and improves posture - Targets the shoulders and quiets the mind
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with shoulder injuries like rotator cuff issues
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - People seeking better posture.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Pavanamuktasana (Wind-Relieving Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Lying Pose (Back) – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Lying on the back and hugging the knees closely to the chest.
BENEFITS: - Massages digestive organs and helps release trapped gas. - Loosens muscles in the lower back and hips. - Promotes a sense of physical ease.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with recent abdominal surgery or a hernia. - Keep head on the floor if you have neck injuries.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners with digestive discomfort.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Prasarita_Padahastasana (Wide Legged Forward Bend)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Standing with feet wide apart while the torso bends forward toward the floor.
BENEFITS: - Grounding posture that stretches the hamstrings and lower back - Helps calm the mind and find relaxation
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid during the third trimester of pregnancy - Skip if you have acute lower back pain or knee injuries
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners looking for relaxation.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Shavasana (Corpse Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Lying Pose (Back) – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - A total relaxation position where you lie flat and motionless on your back.
BENEFITS: - Integrates the benefits of the yoga session. - Reduces stress and lowers the heart rate naturally. - Restores energy and mental clarity.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Use a pillow under knees for lower back discomfort. - Keep the body still for a deep state of rest.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: Everyone at the end of a session.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Shishuasana (Child's Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Sitting Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Kneeling on the floor and folding the chest over the thighs in a resting position.
BENEFITS: - Deeply relaxing stretch for the back and shoulders. - Calms the nervous system and quiets the mind. - Gently stretches the hips and tops of the ankles.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with serious knee injuries. - Keep the head slightly elevated if you have high blood pressure.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - People needing stress relief and beginners.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Sukhasana (Easy Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Sitting Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - A simple cross-legged sitting position used for centering and breathing.

BENEFITS: - Strengthens the back and improves overall body posture. - Widely used as a foundation for seated meditation and relaxation. - Encourages a sense of mental calm and reduces physical tiredness.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - People with recent or chronic knee injuries should sit on a cushion for support. - Avoid sitting in this position for long periods if you experience lower back pain.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners and those with knee injuries.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Trikonasana (Triangle Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Stretching the legs wide and reaching down to create a triangular shape with the body.
BENEFITS: - Improves digestion and physical stability - Reduces stress and mild anxiety - Helps relieve back pain
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with recent injuries to the knees or hips - Not recommended for those with heart problems or dizziness
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - People seeking mental and physical balance.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Utkatasana (Chair Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: Mimicking the action of sitting in an imaginary chair with the arms raised high.
BENEFITS: - Strengthens the legs, back, and core muscles - Builds inner willpower and physical balance
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with recent injuries to the ankles or knees - Skip if you have chronic lower back pain
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners building strength.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Viparita_Karani (Legs Up The Wall Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Lying Pose (Back) – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - Lying on the back with legs resting vertically against a wall.
BENEFITS: - Restorative pose that refreshes the legs and feet. - Effective for calming the brain and reducing anxiety. - Improves circulation and reduces ankle swelling.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with serious eye conditions like glaucoma. - Use a pillow if you have chronic neck or back pain.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners and those standing all day.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Virabhadrasana (Warrior Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - A strong lunge position with one leg forward and arms extended high overhead.
BENEFITS: - Increases stamina and strengthens the arms - Recommended for stiff or "frozen" shoulders
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with high blood pressure or heart issues - Not for those with chronic injuries to the knees or back
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Those in seated jobs and beginners.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Vrikshasana (Tree Pose)
CATEGORY: - Yoga Asana – Standing Pose – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: - A balance where one foot is placed against the opposite inner thigh with arms overhead.
BENEFITS: - Develops better stability and mental focus - Strengthens legs and opens the hips
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid with high blood pressure or vertigo - Not for those with ankle or hip injuries
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners wanting to improve focus.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday

Advanced yoga poses require strength, balance, and body awareness. Examples include Headstand and Handstand. These poses should only be practiced under expert guidance. Source: Summarized from Art of Living (https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday).

Beginner yoga poses focus on stability, balance, and gentle stretching. Common beginner poses include Tadasana, Vajrasana, and Sukhasana. These poses are generally safe and help build flexibility. Source: Summarized from Art of Living (https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday).

Yoga should be practiced with caution during pregnancy, recent surgeries, or chronic illness. Certain inversions and intense poses may be unsafe. Consult a certified instructor or healthcare professional when unsure. Source: Summarized from Art of Living (https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday).
TITLE: Kapalbhati Pranayama
CATEGORY: Pranayama – Breathing Exercise – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: A breathing technique involving forceful exhalations and passive inhalations.
BENEFITS: - Helps improve digestion and energize the body.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Should be avoided during pregnancy or recent surgery.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners and those with knee injuries.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
TITLE: Nadi Shodhana (Alternate Nostril Breathing)
CATEGORY: Pranayama – Breathing Exercise – Beginner Level
DESCRIPTION: A breathing practice involving slow, controlled breathing through alternate nostrils.
BENEFITS: - Helps calm the nervous system and reduce stress.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Avoid if you have severe respiratory infections or nasal blockage.
WHO SHOULD PRACTICE: - Beginners and those with knee injuries.
SOURCE: Art of Living – https://www.artofliving.org/in-en/yoga/beginners/beginner-yoga-asanas-for-everyday
